Administration.text:
Type:
Inhaled steroids
,
Corticosteroid
Dosage Forms: oral inhalation aerosol, metered-dose nasal spray suspension, metered-dose nasal spray solution
Dosage Strengths: oral inhalation aerosol: 40, 80mcg/actuation; metered-dose suspension: 42mcg/actuation; metered-dose solution: 80mcg/actuation
Routes of Administration: inhalation, intranasal spray
Common Trade Names: Qvar, Qvar RediHaler, Beconase AQ, QNASL

Adult_Dosing.text:
Asthma: 40 to 320 mcg by oral inhalation BID
Rhinitis: 2 sprays (80 mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Asthma, 6-11 yo: 40-80 mcg by oral inhalation BID
Rhinitis, 4-11 yo: 1 spray (40 mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Infant risk minimal
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Not to be used as primary treatment for acute asthma exacerbation

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 0.3-3h
Metabolism: Hepatic via CYP3A4
Excretion: Mostly fecal
